body_html:
Thank you for answer! @apaszke , This idea strike to me that is when i read someone's codeSE net use add_module function add a submodule followed by their module's last submodule.

Could you please explain it to me why that ops work and this squeezing an extra submodule in between other submodules won't work? Thanks a lot!

Thank you for answer! @apaszke , This idea strike to me that is when i read someone's codeSE net use  add_module  function add a submodule followed by their module's last submodule.
Could you please explain it to me why that ops work and this squeezing an extra submodule in between other submodules won't work? Thanks a lot!
body:
Thank you for answer! @apaszke , This idea strike to me that is when i read someone's code[SE net](https://github.com/moskomule/senet.pytorch/blob/master/se_inception.py) use  `add_module`  function add a submodule followed by their module's last submodule.

Could you please explain it to me why that ops work and this **squeezing an extra submodule in between other submodules** won't work? Thanks a lot!
